authorsByline: Chris Nalwasky, cnalwasky, Chris Nalwasky | cnalwasky@njadvancemedia.com
title: Girls Tennis preview, 2025: Everything so far with more to come
description: Check back daily for more girls tennis preview posts for 2025.
content:
Manasquan’s Ella Jackwicz hits the ball during her first doubles tennis match against Point Boro, Tuesday, Oct. 8 2024, in Manasquan, N.J. Andrew Mills | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com

The 2025 New Jersey girls tennis season is creeping closer and closer.

Practices are already underway, and regular season matches will be starting shortly.

To get you ready, NJ.com will have an extensive preview package over the next few weeks with information on the top teams, the best players, notes about each conference and more.

See below what’s been posted already and check been daily for more.

Coaches, be sure to fill out our preseason form.

Chris Nalwasky may be reached at cnalwasky@njadvancemedia.com. Follow us on social: Facebook | Instagram | X (formerly Twitter).

The N.J. High School Sports newsletter now appearing in mailboxes 5 days a week. Sign up now and be among the first to get all the boys and girls sports you care about, straight to your inbox each weekday. To add your name, click here.

As always, please report scores to njschoolsports.com. Thank you for relying on us to provide the journalism you can trust. Please consider supporting NJ.com with a subscription.
summary: The 2025 New Jersey girls tennis season is rapidly approaching, with practices already underway and regular season matches set to begin soon. This will be followed by an extensive preview package with information on the top teams, the best players, and notes about each conference. Coaches should fill out their preseason form.
shortSummary: The 2025 season is underway, with competitive matches expected and top players named;

scraped_sources.text:
There are plenty of girls tennis stars who are back for more in 2025.
The list below are the returning student-athletes on the tennis courts who were named All-State and All-Group by NJ Advance Media last year.
There are plenty of girls tennis stars who are back for more in 2025.
The list below are the returning student-athletes on the tennis courts who were named All-State and All-Group by NJ Advance Media last year.
If you purchase a product or register for an account through a link on our site, we may receive compensation. By using this site, you consent to our User Agreement and agree that your clicks, interactions, and personal information may be collected, recorded, and/or stored by us and social media and other third-party partners in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

It’s never too early to be thinking about all of the girls tennis tournaments that’ll take place this season.
Coaches and tournament directors are asked to email their tournament brackets as well as seedings and results to Chris Nalwasky at cnalwasky@njadvancemedia.com as soon as they are completed.
If there are any other tournaments not on this list please send over information for them as well.
Note: Please check back here regularly for added results and stories.
GIRLS TENNIS DATES TO KEEP, 2025
COUNTY/CONF./INVIT. TOURNEYS
Aug. 11: First practice
Aug. 18: Competition start (Optional)
Aug. 26: Hudson-Bergen Invitational
Sept. 6: September Smash | Bracket
Sept. 6-7: Spartan Invitational Tourn.
Sept. 6-7: Moorestown Classic | Bracket
Sept. 13: Blue Devil Invitational | Bracket
Sept. 13: Newark Academy Inv. | Bracket
Sept. 16-17: Bergen County Singles Tourn.
Sept. 16-17: Burlington County Open
Sept. 16, 18, 22, 26, Oct. 3: Shore Conf. Tourn. | Bracket
Sept. 17-18: Passaic County Tourn.
Sept. 17-18: Union County Tourn.
Sept. 19-20: Monmouth County Tourn.
Sept. 19-20: Ocean County Tourn.
Sept. 16, 20: Essex County Tourn. | Bracket
Sept. 20: Haddonfield Inv. (Doubles)
Sept. 20-21: Bergen County Tourn./Inv.
Sept. 20-21: Gloucester County Tourn.
Sept. 25, 27: Hunt./Warren/Sussex Tourn.
Sept. 26-27: Morris County Tourn.
Sept. 26-27: Somerset County Tourn.
Sept. 27-28: Camden County Champs.
Oct. 4: Cumberland County Tourn.
Oct. 10-11: HCIAL Individual Tourn.
Oct. 11-12: Colonial Conf. Tourn.
Oct. 14: Burl. Co. Scholastic League Open
Oct. 15, 17, 21, 23: Hudson Team Tourn. | Bracket
Oct. 17: Prep A Tournament
Oct. 18, 19, 25: SJ Interscholastic Champs.
Oct. 19, 22: Prep B Tournament
Oct. 21-22: Olympic Conference Tourn.
Oct. 21-23: Cape Atlantic League Tourn.
Oct. 21, 23: Colonial Valley Conf. Tourn. | Draws
Oct. 21, 24: Greater Middlesex Conf. Tourn.
Nov. 1: MAPL Tournament
NJSIAA TEAM TOURNEYS
Sept. 15: Entry forms close/conflict of interest form due
Sept. 22: Cutoff (Team and individuals)
Sept. 23: Power Points close (12 p.m.)
Sept. 25: Seeding meeting
Sept. 27-30: Sectional First Round
Oct. 7: Quarterfinals all groups
Oct. 9: Sectional Semifinals all groups
Oct. 14: Sectional Finals
Oct. 16: State semifinals and finals
NJSIAA SINGLES & DOUBLES TOURNEYS
Sept. 15: Entry forms close/conflict of interest form due
Sept. 22: Cutoff (Team and individuals)
Sept. 23: Individual entries close (12 p.m.)
Sept. 25: Seeding meeting
Oct. 4: Doubles First Round/Singles first and second round
Oct. 5: Doubles second and third round/Singles third and fourth round
Oct. 11: Quarterfinals/Semifinals
Oct. 12: Finals
Chris Nalwasky may be reached at cnalwasky@njadvancemedia.com . Follow us on social: Facebook | Instagram | X (formerly Twitter).

Scroll through below to get a full look at this year’s NJSIAA group/sectional alignments for the postseason.
The break down is the same as last fall.
New classifications are expected to come up next season as they run on a two-year basis.

argos_summary: The article previews the 2025 New Jersey girls tennis season, noting that practices have begun and regular‑season matches will start soon. NJ.com will provide an extensive preview package covering top teams, standout players, conference notes, and tournament schedules. Coaches are urged to submit preseason forms and tournament brackets to Chris Nalwasky, and the piece lists key dates for county, conference, and NJSIAA tournaments. Returning All‑State and All‑Group players are highlighted, and a newsletter subscription is promoted for weekly sports updates.
